main.name: Kenneth Yeung
main.description: Currently I am working as a Cloud Architect for one of the biggest German car company.
main.bio:
Hello and welcome! 

 This page is my digital canvas, crafted to not only exhibit projects I'm deeply passionate about but also to delve into the fascinating world of React development. My mission is to clarify the coding process, offering in-depth explanations and insights for each project. I'm well aware of the confusion that bare code snippets can bring and am determined to provide a more enlightening experience here.

My professional journey has taken me from the structured world of Mechanical Engineering to the dynamic and ever-evolving landscapes of Software Development, Cloud, Platform Engineering, and CI/CD. It's been nothing short of exhilarating. Through sharing my story, I aim to light the way for fellow engineers considering a similar path.

Previously, I honed my skills in Java and JavaScript development at Accenture, and I am currently embracing the role of an AWS Architect at Volkswagen. These positions have immersed me in a variety of projects, enabling fruitful collaborations with clients and a deep dive into Software Development and Platform Engineering, particularly focusing on AWS and Kubernetes. My background in engineering has been a key asset, allowing me to approach complex technical challenges with innovative solutions. I'm a firm believer in the power of understanding the core of a problem; it's the foundation for impactful analysis and transforming developments into real-world value.

When I step away from my desk, I recharge by engaging in physical activity, connecting with nature, and riding my motorbike. These pursuits offer a vital balance to my technical endeavors, sparking my creativity and sustaining my motivation.

workTimeline.title: AWS Consultant
workTimeline.description: Kenneth has been working on many client projects for two German premium car manufacturers and a national government. He supported in the area of Java, Sprint Boot, JavaScript, Dojo, Jenkins for Continious Integration/Continious Deployment, AWS Service, Azure cloud and Terraform as Infrastructure as a Code.

workTimeline.title: Quality Engineer
workTimeline.description: As a Quality Engineer, Kenneth was responsible of the comfirmity and releases of the landing gear parts of the Airbus 320/321/XLR321 planes.

testimonials.text:
In my role as Agile Coach on a client project, I had the pleasure of working with Kenneth for some time.
 He came as an additional developer to an already existing team and integrated great into the team within a very short time.
